function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Global health crisis covid-19 pandemic impacting professional opinions regarding occupant health in buildings","category":"Visitors","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of focus on occupant health in building projects.","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited research on social well-being in the built environment","category":"Participation","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty in conducting research on social well-being in built environment","category":"Participation","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate guidelines for building attributes","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited research on building attributes","category":"Participation","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited research on ergonomics settings in buildings and its musculoskeletal consequences on occupants.","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Discrepancy between professionals’ opinions about the prevalence of musculoskeletal pain and limited research focus in this area.","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High levels of stress, depression, and anxiety due to stay-at-home mandates and lack of social connections.","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased concentration loss due to stay-at-home mandates and stress.","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Need for more research on mental well-being in built environments","category":"Participation","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Privacy concerns among building occupants due to the continuous collection of personal physiological and psychometric data.","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Difficulty in effectively collecting and analyzing physiological and psychometric data, requiring coordination with data scientists and comprehensive data storage and analysis infrastructure.","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited use of physiological/psychometric measurements for occupant health assessments","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited use of objective health measures in research studies","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited studies and research on occupant health in commercial and industrial buildings.","category":"Participation","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Importance given to office spaces in research and practice, leading to neglect of other building types.","category":"Participation","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of research on different building types and their impact on occupant health","category":"Participation","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of occupant-centric building operation modules","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient influence of facility managers on building health","category":"Leadership","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of interest from employers and building owners","category":"Leadership","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Resistance to the healthy building movement","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Scarcity of real-world cases and lack of confidence in healthy building initiatives","category":"Participation","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of pandemic on building professionals’ perspective regarding buildings’ impact on occupant health.","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Pandemic bias effect on questionnaire responses","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential lag in academic publications compared to current trends","category":"Participation","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of clear and commonly accepted definition of ’healthy building’","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited systematic process to incorporate who’s definitions of health in buildings","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Building guidelines may not prioritize occupant health","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited adoption of health-focused building standards","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Low certification numbers for health-focused building standards","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Sub-standard building conditions in low-income and minority households","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Residential segregation based on race and ethnicity","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher level of indoor air pollutants in african american and hispanic houses","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Racial segregation and lower housing standards leading to health burden on children","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Children studying in schools near highways exposed to hazardous pollutants","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate working conditions for laborers and employees in blue collar jobs","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of conceptualization of built environmental justice and health inequalities","category":"Participation","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Over-reliance on indoor cooling systems leading to increased electricity consumption, energy demand, and greenhouse gas emissions during heat waves.","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Capital cost associated with introducing iot and intelligent furniture in healthy buildings","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of antibacterial fabrics and finishes may lead to a false sense of security and reduce adherence to proper hygiene practices","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Pandemic diseases transcending international borders","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Historical precedent of quarantine in epidemic control","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of home quarantine","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate isolation and quarantine facilities for infected individuals","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Aesthetic use of balconies can lead to overcrowding and close proximity, increasing the risk of disease transmission","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Balconies used as smoking places","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of privacy and social distancing on balconies","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of privacy on the balcony may lead to behaviors that increase the risk of disease transmission, such as talking loudly and playing loud music","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliability of questionnaire data","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium"}]}
